meanings.definition: In an arch or mischievous manner.
meanings.sent1: She winked archly at her friend during class.
meanings.sent2: The cat looked at the fish archly, plotting its next move.
meanings.sent3: The child grinned archly before pulling a prank on his sister.
meanings.sent4: The fox eyed the chickens archly, planning its clever approach.
meanings.sent5: Her raised eyebrow conveyed an archly playful attitude.

meanings.definition: In a sly or cunning way.
meanings.sent1: He answered the question archly, trying to outsmart his opponent.
meanings.sent2: The spy moved archly through the shadows, unseen by his target.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon looked archly at the picnic basket, knowing it held treats.
meanings.sent4: The magician smiled archly, hinting at the trick up his sleeve.
meanings.sent5: Her eyes gleamed archly as she revealed her clever plan.
